epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

hazardous_substances.notes: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m続 of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required
background_data_sources: Cement supplier data and EPD factors 2022
Cementitious supplementary materials supplier data and Ecoinvent factors 2022
Coarse aggregate diesel invoices and Ecoinvent factors 2022
Manufactured mains water invoices and Ecoinvent factors 2022
Admixtures supplier data and Ecoinvent factors 2023

NSW_ACT.composition: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.composition: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.composition: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.composition: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.composition: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) is recognized but not included in this EPD

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach conforming to EN 15804

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

resource_use: Use of renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
additional_indicators: Human toxicity potential cancer and non-cancer

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V4.0 and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4
Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects
